intro: Crepidomanes australiense, commonly known as the Australian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically succulent and adapted to arid conditions, allowing it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Crepidomanes australiense is often found in coastal and inland regions where it contributes to stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
